box.code:
# Download from official website
# https://nodejs.org/

# Using Node Version Manager (nvm) - Recommended
# Install nvm
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash
# or
wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash

# Install latest LTS version
nvm install --lts
nvm use --lts

# Install specific version
nvm install 18.17.0
nvm use 18.17.0

# Verify installation
node --version
# v18.17.0

npm --version
# 9.6.7

# Using package managers
# macOS with Homebrew
brew install node

# Ubuntu/Debian
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_lts.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs

# Windows
# Download installer from nodejs.org
# Or use Chocolatey
choco install nodejs-lts

# Initialize new project
npm init
npm init -y  # Skip questions

# Install packages
npm install express          # Install locally
npm install -g nodemon       # Install globally
npm install express mongoose cors  # Multiple packages

# Install specific versions
npm install express@4.18.0
npm install express@latest

# Development dependencies
npm install --save-dev jest nodemon

# package.json scripts
{
  "scripts": {
    "start": "node app.js",
    "dev": "nodemon app.js",
    "test": "jest",
    "build": "npm run build:css && npm run build:js"
  }
}

# Run scripts
npm start
npm run dev
npm test

# Package management
npm list                     # List installed packages
npm outdated                 # Check for outdated packages
npm update                   # Update packages
npm uninstall express        # Remove package

# Audit and security
npm audit                    # Check for vulnerabilities
npm audit fix                # Fix vulnerabilities
npm fund                     # View funding info

# Publishing packages
npm login
npm publish
npm version patch            # Bump version
npm unpublish --force        # Remove published package

# Install PM2 globally
npm install -g pm2

# Basic usage
pm2 start app.js              # Start application
pm2 start app.js -i max       # Start with cluster mode
pm2 restart app               # Restart application
pm2 stop app                  # Stop application
pm2 delete app                # Remove from PM2
pm2 logs                      # Show logs
pm2 monit                     # Monitor dashboard

# Ecosystem file (ecosystem.config.js)
module.exports = {
  apps: [{
    name: 'my-app',
    script: './app.js',
    instances: 'max',         // Use all CPU cores
    exec_mode: 'cluster',     // Cluster mode
    env: {
      NODE_ENV: 'development',
      PORT: 3000
    },
    env_production: {
      NODE_ENV: 'production',
      PORT: 80
    },
    error_file: './logs/err.log',
    out_file: './logs/out.log',
    log_file: './logs/combined.log',
    time: true
  }]
};

# Start with ecosystem file
pm2 start ecosystem.config.js
pm2 start ecosystem.config.js --env production

# PM2 commands for production
pm2 startup                  # Generate startup script
pm2 save                     # Save current process list
pm2 resurrect                # Restore saved processes

# Monitoring
pm2 status                   # Show status
pm2 show app                 # Show details
pm2 logs app --lines 100     # Show last 100 lines
pm2 flush                    # Clear logs

# Zero-downtime reload
pm2 reload app               # Zero-downtime reload

# Configuration management
pm2 init                     # Generate sample config

# Docker with Node.js
# Dockerfile
FROM node:18-alpine

WORKDIR /app

COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci --only=production

COPY . .

EXPOSE 3000

USER node

CMD ["node", "app.js"]

# Build and run
# docker build -t my-node-app .
# docker run -p 3000:3000 -d my-node-app

# Environment variables in production
# Use .env file or system environment variables
# Never commit secrets to version control
